fields.description:
I've uploaded a repository today and then noticed the username was wrong for all of the commits, so I've stripped all of them and pushed a correct version of the repo after that. Now the overview page shows commits of the original repo, with broken revision links etc.:

http://bitbucket.org/infrared/cheesecake-service/overview/

Compare that with the actual list of revisions:

http://bitbucket.org/infrared/cheesecake-service/changesets/

Hello,

I have one inbox item and I have read it.\\
But inbox counter says "(1)".\\
More than that, as I browse pages, counter randomly drops to no unread and appears back as "(1)".

Looks like memcache invalidation issue :)

The mini avatar thumbnails on the change overview are all broken (404):\\
http://bitbucket.org/ianb/silverlining/overview/

I populated a repository with files from my Windows 7 partition. These contained danish (aka international) characters. Mercurial turned out to be unfriendly in the way it obtains file names and thus checks in junk names.

In the bitbucket source browser I noticed that one folder (imported from a folder with the Å character in it) was empty, even though it actually contained several files locally. After renaming the folder to not contain the character the files inside became visible.

Note that Å is a particularly troublesome character because it has two UTF-8 encodings (e.g. A-WITH-RING and RINGED-A), both representing the same character. These are known as NFC and NFD encodings. Because my files originated on a Mac, which converts everything it saves to disk to NFD encoding, their current encoding is NFD (Windows uses the encoding it's given, which avoids a ton of problems, but I digress).

On another note, I had serious problems getting the push to work at all. Anything above 30-50MB is lucky to get through, returning either 502 Bad Gateway or 500 Server Error. It took 14 (!!!) pushes to finally send all the repository data across the wire. Is this a bitbucket or Mercurial problem?
fields.summary: Files invisible in web UI when folder contains international character (BB-802)

Hi,\\
I'm quite new to bitbucket/mercurial, so please bear with me, if I mess up something with this ticket.

Problem:\\
My Newsfeed at http://bitbucket.org/nureineide/ambestengestern.de/ shows commits coming from a user named "benjamin", although the actual bitbucket username that made these commits/pushes was "nureineide" (that's myself).\\
To give a hint what might be causing this problem: My username on my local machine (were the commits/pushes came from) is "benjamin", and my "username" entry in my local .hgrc is "benjamin".

I hope this makes sense. If not, I'm happy to clarify further.

Thanks for bitbucket!

Cheers, Benjamin

fields.description:
Every so often, I get very long delays loading web pages on bitbucket.org.  It doesn't seem to matter which page I'm loading.  If I wait long enough, I get this page:

{{{\\
Proxy Error

The proxy server received an invalid response from an upstream server.\\
The proxy server could not handle the request GET /notifications/read/47893/pull-request.

Reason: Error reading from remote server

Apache/2.2.9 (Debian) Server at bitbucket.org Port 80\\
}}}

Where "/notifications/read/47893/pull-request" is the path of the page I'm trying to load.  The problem is intermittent -- I won't be able to load any bitbucket page for a few minutes; then everything starts working again.

The attachment links point at the ticket in which they reside instead of the attached file so the attachments are inaccessible.

Windows 7, chrome 4 (with adblock)

Each user should be able to set an account default but override it on repository level. It should be possible to disable emails in the diff service if the changes where made by yourself.

The standard behavior will be to send in any case as this is the current one.

fields.description:
Hi,

I saw this message while trying to add a large number of files as initial check-in. I just installed Mercury 1.5 and was attempting to create my first real repository. Snow Leopard. Command line Mercury performed the task with no errors.

Uncaught exception: NSInternalInconsistencyException\\
parent!=self

{code}
-[HgRevision setParent:] (in Murky) + 116
-[HgRepository _checkRevisions] (in Murky) + 1306
-[HgRepository updateStatus:] (in Murky) + 27
-[RepoController(Actions) _commitSheetDidEnd:returnCode:context:] (in Murky) + 192
-[NSApplication endSheet:returnCode:] (in AppKit) + 349
-[RepoController(Actions) endCommitSheet:] (in Murky) + 241
-[NSApplication sendAction:to:from:] (in AppKit) + 112
-[NSControl sendAction:to:] (in AppKit) + 108
-[NSCell _sendActionFrom:] (in AppKit) + 169
-[NSCell trackMouse:inRect:ofView:untilMouseUp:] (in AppKit) + 1808
-[NSButtonCell trackMouse:inRect:ofView:untilMouseUp:] (in AppKit) + 524
	
{code}

Please report this bug (you can copy & paste the text).

When I restarted Murky, it gave me another error immediately.

Uncaught exception: NSInternalInconsistencyException\\
parent!=self

{code}
-[HgRevision setParent:] (in Murky) + 116
-[HgRepository _checkRevisions] (in Murky) + 1306
-[HgRepository revisions] (in Murky) + 76
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueCoding) valueForKey:] (in Foundation) + 413
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueCoding) valueForKeyPath:] (in Foundation) + 204
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueCoding) valueForKeyPath:] (in Foundation) + 405
-[NSBinder _valueForKeyPath:ofObject:mode:raisesForNotApplicableKeys:] (in AppKit) + 841
-[NSBinder valueForBinding:resolveMarkersToPlaceholders:] (in AppKit) + 188
-[NSArrayDetailBinder _refreshDetailContentInBackground:] (in AppKit) + 428
-[NSBinder _performConnectionEstablishedRefresh] (in AppKit) + 85
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueBindingCreation) bind:toObject:withKeyPath:options:] (in AppKit) + 721
	
{code}

Please report this bug (you can copy & paste the text).

I think it would be useful to be able to specify what default view\\
users get when entering source view. By default it shows the tip,\\
regardless of what branch it is on, which is generally not what I\\
want. I branch to try things out, and share the branches using\\
bitbucket, but the version for "general consumption" should be the\\
latest revision of default.\\
It would be nice if I could specify Tip or a specific named Tag/Branch\\
to be the default view.

(Also, the links should probably have cursor: pointer css..)

fields.description: If a user prefers one protocol over the order for communicating with Bitbucket she should be able to set it as a preference so, for example, the  clone command displayed for every repository uses the prefered protocol.
fields.summary: Preference to choose among HTTP and SSH as default communication method

fields.description:
I went through usual stuff, commit and push cycle. Here is my repository : <<user l0nwlf>>  , as you can see every commit message is appearing twice.

Reproducing it :

{{{\\
#!shell

Shashwat-Anands-MacBook-Pro:project-euler l0nwlf$ hg status\\
M TODO.txt\\
A 21.py\\
Shashwat-Anands-MacBook-Pro:project-euler l0nwlf$ hg commit -m 'adding problem 21'\\
Shashwat-Anands-MacBook-Pro:project-euler l0nwlf$ hg push http://bitbucket.org/l0nwlf/project-euler/\\
pushing to http://bitbucket.org/l0nwlf/project-euler/\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: l0nwlf\\
password:\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 1 changesets with 2 changes to 2 files\\
bb/acl: l0nwlf is allowed. accepted payload.\\
quota: 10.2 KB in use, 1.0 GB available (0.00% used)

}}}
fields.summary: 'commit message' appearing twice after each push.

fields.description:
I already wrote this to the google group, but as it might have a security impact I'll post again here.

blog.bitbucket.org seems to have been hacked. Look at the google cache page here:\\
http://209.85.129.132/search?q=cache:TW4A27KmAVMJ:blog.bitbucket.org/+Its+software+licenses+through+coupon+description.+Most+new+Adobe+OnLocation+CS4&cd=1&hl=de&ct=clnk&gl=de\\
(incidentially, this is also the first hit for the search term "Its software licenses through coupon description. Most new Adobe OnLocation CS4".

Somehow this SEO spam page is shown in my stock FF 3.5, Ubuntu 9.10. Chrome on the same system will display the blog front page.

I have dropped a stripped-down packet dump of visiting the page with both browsers at http://kevin-read.com/static/download/bitbucket.pcap

Please look into this immediately. If the blog was somehow hacked, this might have enabled access to other databases.

Best regards,

Kevin
fields.summary: Blog seems to have been hacked?

fields.description:
When previewing a wiki page which has tables in it, they don't seem to be css styled; they don't look the same way they look after  saving the page.

So the preview is not really showing exactly how the page will look like when is rendered.
fields.summary: Tables don't have style on preview

fields.description:
In the "shortlog" display (e.g. on overview pages), the A/M/D columns should have a blank space instead of printing a 0 when a changeset has no adds/mods/deletes.

This would make it much easier to pick out which changesets have additions, which have deletions, etc.
fields.summary: Shortlog should display empty space instead of 0 under A/M/D

fields.description:
I can pull from ssh but not push using ssh. Pushing and pulling works over https.

Here are the basic commands I am trying to use:\\
{{{\\
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
hg pull ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/dripton/hgcollapse/\\
hg update\\
hg push ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
}}}

on the last push I get a message:\\
"remote: abort: could not lock repository jfh/hgcollapse/: Permission denied"

However if the last command is:\\
{{{\\
hg push https://jfh:***@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
}}}

Then it works (Of course I replace the {{{***}}} with my password.)

What am I doing wrong? Any ideas of other information I need to provide? Or what is set up wrong?

----
===Notes:\\
I originally created two bitbucket accounts one jasonh and then later jfh. I was going to use them for separate things (jasonh a work related one, and jfh an open source related one...)

my bitbucket account jfh has my id_rsa.pub uploaded.

The name in the bitbucket account tab is the same as in my .hgrc file.

----
===Transcript:\\
{{{\\
[Bolt:Volumes/QuickSilver/Development/sandbox] $

[Bolt:Volumes/QuickSilver/Development/sandbox] $ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
destination directory: hgcollapse\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 7 changesets with 7 changes to 1 files\\
updating to branch default\\
1 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved

[Bolt:QuickSilver/Development/sandbox/hgcollapse] hgcollapse 6(6) $ hg pull ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/dripton/hgcollapse/\\
pulling from ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/dripton/hgcollapse/\\
searching for changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 4 changesets with 4 changes to 1 files\\
(run 'hg update' to get a working copy)

[Bolt:QuickSilver/Development/sandbox/hgcollapse] hgcollapse 6(10) $ hg update\\
1 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved

[Bolt:QuickSilver/Development/sandbox/hgcollapse] hgcollapse 10(10) $ hg push ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
searching for changes\\
remote: abort: could not lock repository jfh/hgcollapse/: Permission denied\\
abort: unexpected response: empty string

[Bolt:QuickSilver/Development/sandbox/hgcollapse] hgcollapse 10(10) $ hg push https://jfh:***@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
pushing to https://jfh:***@bitbucket.org/jfh/hgcollapse/\\
searching for changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 4 changesets with 4 changes to 1 files\\
}}}

Best regards,\\
Cédric Bonhomme

Integrating the project's wiki with its source code repository means to have a folder in the repo which contains the docs. The user could then declare here on BitBucket which one of the repo's folders should be used as wiki.

This would allow the documentation to grow along with the source code instead of both evolving separately from each other when having a repository for each of them.
fields.summary: Integrate wiki with source code repository

Hi, just wanted to let you know that when a user types their email address with any capital letters in it, Gravatar won't work.

Example:\\
NessDan@live.com was the email I entered and I lost my Gravatar.\\
nessdan@live.com is what I changed it to and Gravatar re-enabled.

You may wanna set the user's email to lowercase when grabbing an avatar.

fields.description:
I deleted the rstarkov/aerobrakerhomfd repository a while ago, and set a redirect notification.

However, on this page http://bitbucket.org/rstarkov/ it's still listed with its full description (which I can no longer edit), and clicking the link does //not// show the "this repo was deleted" redirect.

I'd like to suggest that deleted repos should not be displayed on the user's page, or if they must be, then at least the description should remain editable.

Additionally, repos which have Wiki as the landing page should support redirection properly.

eg: in http://bitbucket.org/normanr/rtirishrail/issue/2/store-a-list-of-favourite-stations

{{{\\
→ <<cset 5c589b79ac13>>\\
}}}

renders as:

→ Wiki macro error: Changeset 5c589b79ac13 not found.

and not:

→ [[http://bitbucket.org/normanr/rtirishrail/changeset/5c589b79ac13/|r6:5c589b79ac13]]
fields.summary: cset macro fails to find changeset (BB-786)

fields.description:
Attention:

I just deleted a private repo (robares/mlos) and errantly pasted a value in the redirect field. I really just wanted to delete the repo and forget about it but now I can't delete the redirect. Two observations:

1.) Please delete this redirect (the value entered was 'h1 there!' which is my password manager password (now changed)).

2.) Once the redirect was created, I logged out and accessed the repo (rares/mlos) and it was now _public_ (this repo was originally created as private) and the redirect link was public as well. I was not sure if the deleted link (robares/mlos) should honor the fact that it was private originally but I just wanted you guys to be aware.

see http://microformats.org/wiki/rel-me\\
twitter does it, flick does it, identi.ca does it, friendfeed does it ...

should be to hard to implement either ;-)

fields.description:
Hey guys, i'm french and i've got a problem using the twitter service.\\
In commits, i use accents like "é, è, à", but commits vith accented characters doesn't appear in twitter.\\
I think that characters are not encoded when twitter api is called.

Thanks, and sorry for my bad English :p
Po pokonaniu //*Infernal Attacker*//a tworza sie 4 wrogie, niewidzialne jednostki, ktore atakuja i których nie da sie namierzyć.

I logged in/created my account using an OpenID url.

I wanted to delete my private repo and couldn't because I appear to have had no password, so I requested a new password to be sent to me.  It was sent, and I tried to use it to reset my password in my account screen and it won't let me do so.  The error it gives is\\
oldpw

{code}
* Old password is wrong. Please enter a valid password.
{code}

I cut and pasted the password and then I receieved via email and then I tried hand-typing it.  I requested another reset and this also doesn't work.

I think there's something awry in your OpenID account management.

This is the converse of BCLOUD-262; I dorked around with my project way back in the day when I was a n00b, and I somehow ended up in the situation where <current version> is a fork of <older version>.  I'd like to remove that "eventlet is a fork of eventlet-08" notice without nuking my followers or issues.

To say in a different way; the two repos are http://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/ and http://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet-08/; I'd like to make it so that eventlet-08 is a fork of eventlet (or simply unrelated).

When I'm trying to pull patch queue repo with ssh, no changes are found in the main repo:\\
{{{\\
#!sh

$ hg qclone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/vkorenev/jopenxml-ant/\\
no changes found\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 2 changesets with 6 changes to 5 files\\
updating to branch default\\
5 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
0 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
}}}\\
With https everything is ok:\\
{{{\\
#!sh

$ hg qclone https://vkorenev@bitbucket.org/vkorenev/jopenxml-ant/\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 6 changesets with 120 changes to 117 files\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 2 changesets with 6 changes to 5 files\\
updating to branch default\\
5 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
117 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
}}}

fields.description: "Bitstream Vera Sans Mono" font doesn't have Cyrillic support. "DejaVu Sans Mono" does have it and is based on the former. I suggest a patch to http://bitbucket.org/m/css/layout.css

http://bitbucket.org/willie/hg-cht-translation/

Would you please fix that? Thanks.

I made revisions to my wiki yesterday that I saw and saved.  When I look in my personal timeline, I see 8 revisions for Feb 8.  However, when I go to the wiki, all of the revisions that I made yesterday are completely missing.  The don't appear in the page histories, and the pages are in the state that they were in on Sunday.  Pulling from the wiki repository shows no new revisions.

What the heck happened to my data?

there were no strip or anythink

could you please look into that?

thank you

When viewing the changeset list, the paginator seems to miss the last page. This appears to be a counting bug, as the last "page" always has less than a "full page" worth of changesets.

Examples:\\
http://bitbucket.org/pennyarcade/pa/changesets/5f335ed44442:c179948d3cb3/\\
http://bitbucket.org/pennyarcade/pa/changesets/c179948d3cb3:f916bef66112/

Keeping the default number of elements per page seems to mitigate the bug.

When you rename a repository, I feel like the old repository URL should forward automatically to the new repository. If that makes sense?

Perhaps you can render the same html as the comment page and generate a multipart message.

Long time ago I deleted the 'writings' repository from my account. But it still visible on the right sidebar of my profile page: http://bitbucket.org/srid/

Could you please remove it?

I'm using the lighthouseapp.com integration, and I get:

"was committed by yonasy"

beanstalkapp.com  would write:

"was committed by <link to lighthouse account>"

Since both are useful, depending on the user's preference, I'm requesting to have an option setting:

(    ) Link commits to BitBucket user\\
( i.e. display "yonasy" as a link to http://bitbucket.org/yonasy/ )

(  ) Link commits to Lighthouseapp user\\
( i.e. display "Yonas Yanfa" as a link to http://example.lighthouseapp.com/users/12345 )

* Yonas
Create support to user add a alternative e-mail for receive notifications.

Hey.

The SSL certificate on bitbucket.org seems to be expired since January 13, 2010.

Regards.

Hello,

it would be nice if bitbucket offered a feed of just my (or another profile) which contains my commits. It would be even nicer if there could be a combined commits/comments/bugs feed and a way to seperate them.

Something like bitbucket.org/ikanobori/feed/commits+bugs+comments.(rss|atom|json).

I wanted to get an RSS feed of my activity, so I followed myself. The downside to this is that my user page looks kinda wonky.

You might want to exclude the current user from the followers/following query.

Embedded source file fails to render. Copy and embed <script/> from the source browser, and copy it in any plain htm file. During rendering, the javascript fails:

Foutdetails webpagina

Gebruikersagent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.648; .NET CLR 3.5.21022; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; InfoPath.1)\\
Tijdstempel: Thu, 4 Feb 2010 06:48:34 UTC

Bericht: Tekenreeksconstante is niet afgesloten\\
Regel: 63\\
Teken: 165\\
Code: 0\\
URI: http://bitbucket.org/paultak/public/src/c55022dddf8f/bizzbutler/Windows/Library/BizzButler.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes/BizzButler.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.csproj?embed=t

Basically, it says that a string literal was not properly closed on line 63, character 165.

That is correct, as can be seen in the code I've downloaded using the URL above:

<attachment>It appears that string literals cannot span multiple lines.
fields.summary: Embedded source file fails to render.

fields.description:
If you delete a project that is being followed, the "follow" references are not deleted as well.

This is a problem because I haven't found a way to stop follow a project that no longer exists, so you end up collecting phantom projects :)

When browsing sources, the "copy/paste:" link does not seem to copy anything. That is, not in the clip board. Selecting the <script/> markup with the mouse is not possible, as text cannot be selected. The only way to select the text, is by right clicking (IE8) --> Select All, followed by CTRL-C. This is not very user friendly.

I believe there should be a copy-to-clipboard function.
fields.summary: "copy/paste:" link does not seem to copy anything.
